slides.title: Claim history
slides.originalNotes:
Claim history
Because records are uneditable, the claim history acts as a legally referenceable record of who did what with respect to a given claim.
By configuring history events, the History screen can include any kind of event an insurer wants to track. For example, it can track changes to a field, including both old and new values.

slides.title: History record
slides.originalNotes:
History record
Each history record documents a single event.
Claim history record fields
include:
Type - The claim event causing the entry in the History table, such as an exposure being opened, closed or reopened, a stopped check, an activity's due date changed, and so on.
Related To - Whether the event relates to the entire claim or one of its parts, like an exposure or reserve line.
User - Person who caused the event.
Event Time Stamp – Date and time the event occurred (in descending order, by default).
Description - A brief description of the event. This is provided for history entries written by ClaimCenter, and you may add your own when you write rules that create custom history events.
Link — If available, a link to the DV (Detail View) of the object's details. In the base configuration, links are enabled for Transaction Approvals. That way, you can rapidly review the Approval information — if the Approval was approved or rejected, and why or why noto Note that the creation of a Reserve is not recorded in Claim history in the base application.
Description and Link are optional fields.

slides.title: Claim history type
slides.originalNotes:
Claim history type
The base application claim history event types are defined in the History Type typelist. These history events will be generatedby ClaimCenter by default regardless of configuration. More details on these event types can be found in the ClaimCenter Application Guide, under the Claim History section.
slides.notes:
Claim history type

slides.ocrText:
| Claim history type

Is the claim event causing the history record to be created

+ Example: Closing a claim is an event which produces a history record of
type “Closed”

History screen has a history type filter

+ Can search for history events of a particular type

ClaimCenter comes with standard history types which trigger
automatically created claim history records

+ Standard events include editing, assigning, viewing, approvals, and so
on

+ Some events are not included in history in the base application, such as
creating activities and creating reserves

ClaimCenter may be configured to have custom history types

+ This defines additional events which are added to the claim history

slides.title: Creating custom claim history types
slides.originalNotes:
Creating custom claim history types
You can add new history types to the CustomHistoryType typelist and use them to create custom history events using preupdate rules.

When you add a custom history event to a claim's history, the value in the Name field appears as the history type.

The image shows the CustomHistoryType typelist as it appears in the base application.

| Recording custom history events Gi

* Create a preupdate rule that captures the history condition

• The action uses the createCustomHistoryEvent () method on Claim

• Syntax: Claim.createCustomHistoryEvent(CustomHistory Type. TC_CustomHistoryType, Text)
* Claim is the claim to which you are adding a history record
* CustomHistoryType is the history type
* Textis the text to be displayed in the history record’s description column (on the screen)
